page.title: 01Area Around Rawdon
page.content: The area lies mainly on the southerly slope from the ridge of the Aire- Wharfe divide down to the River Aire. It is dominated by{Billing Hill}231m above sea level,a local landmark. {Rawdon}village is in the centre of the D block,part of{Horsforth}at the eastern end and{Yeadon}on the west. These villages developed as wool textile communities based on ancient settlements.This function has declined greatly over recent years but each village has kept some characteristics of earlier eras.Despite much commuter development during the last 30 years the communities remain fairly compact. Adjacent open fields and woods provide an important social amenity.Much of the area has been designated a{Special {Landscape Area}by Leeds City Council on the 1984 Local Plan.
